title: Alphabet's 'moonshot' lab to cut staff and woo investors
text: Focus shifting to spinning out fresh businesses as independent companies funded through market-based capital Google co-founder Larry Page. Photo: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg Google owner Alphabet’s lab for pioneering technology is laying off dozens of employees as it turns to outside investors to help fund its ventures. The division, known as X, has in recent months ramped up discussions on funding with venture capitalists and other investors, according to sources.
